Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: AmerisourceBergen Specialty Group pled guilty and agreed to pay a total of $260 million to resolve criminal liability for its distribution of oncology supportive-care drugs from a facility that was not registered with the Food and Drug Administration.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-edny/pr/amerisourcebergen-specialty-group-pleads-guilty-distributing-misbranded-drugs-and

Description: The settlement resolved claims that US Bioservices violated the Anti-Kickback Statute and the False Claims Act by participating in a kickback scheme with Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corp. relating to the latter's drug Exjade.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/pr/acting-manhattan-us-attorney-announces-134-million-settlement-civil-healthcare-fraud

Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/usao/nye/pr/2007/2007jul09.html

Secondary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: AmerisourceBergen Corporation and its subsidiaries AmerisourceBergen Specialty Group, AmerisourceBergen Drug Corporation, Oncology Supply Company, and Medical Initiatives Inc.  agreed to pay $625 million to resolve allegations arising from its operation of a facility that improperly repackaged oncology-supportive injectable drugs into pre-filled syringes and improperly distributed those syringes to physicians treating vulnerable cancer patients.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/amerisourcebergen-corporation-agrees-pay-625-million-resolve-allegations-it-illegally
https://us7.campaign-archive.com/?u=dffe711cd807d3fba5777bbf0&id=df6913c241

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Drug distributor AmerisourceBergen Corporation agreed to pay more than $99 million to settle multistate litigation alleging that it illegally introduced adulterated, misbranded drugs into interstate commerce andf made false claims to state Medicaid programs. This was part of a larger $625 settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-amerisourcebergen-corporation
Info Source: http://www.illinoisattorneygeneral.gov/pressroom/2018_10/20181003.html

Description: U.S. Bioservices agreed to pay $13.4 million to settle multistate allegations that it recommended the drug Exjade to Medicaid patients in exchange for kickbacks from Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corporation, which marketed the drug.
Info Source: https://www.arkansasag.gov/media-center/news-releases/attorneys-general-reach-13.4-million-settlement-with-u.s-bioservices-pharmacy/

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Contained in a spreadsheet received from the agency on October 2, 2020 in response to an open records request. The spreadsheet included data from  the agency's Oculus database, which can be searched at https://prodenv.dep.state.fl.us/DepNexus/public/searchPortal
Notes: Case number is the designation given by the DEP's Office of General Counsel.

Primary Offense: off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products
Description: The three major pharmaceutical distributors--McKesson, AmerisourceBergen and Cardinal Health--reached a $21 billion settlement with a group of states to resolve litigation alleging the improper sale of pain medications, contributing to the national opioid epidemic. McKesson agreed to pay 38.1 percent of the total, while AmerisourceBergen paid 31 percent and Cardinal Health 30.9 percent.
Info Source: https://ncdoj.gov/attorney-general-josh-stein-announces-26-billion-agreement-with-opioid-distributors-manufacturer/
